parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Known, an acquaintance. From ginosko; well-known.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And, even, also, namely.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
Of Hebrew origin; Israel, the adopted name of Jacob, including his descendants.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A Nazarene, an inhabitant of Nazareth. From Nazareth; a Nazoraean, i.e. Inhabitant of Nazareth; by extension, a Christian.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From stauros; to impale on the cross; figuratively, to extinguish passion or selfishness.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Or prolonged paristano from para and histemi; to stand beside, i.e. to exhibit, proffer, recommend, substantiate; or to be at hand, aid.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
(a) sound, healthy, pure, whole, (b) wholesome. From the base of auzano; healthy, i.e. Well; figuratively, true.
